style.name: International-Style Pilsener
style.description: International Pilseners are straw/golden in color and are well attenuated. This medium-bodied beer is often brewed with rice, corn, wheat, or other grain or sugar adjuncts making up part of the mash. Hop bitterness is low to medium. Hop flavor and aroma are low. Residual malt sweetness is low--it does not predominate but may be perceived. Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be perceived. Very low levels of sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) character, if perceived, are acceptable. There should be no chill haze.

style.name: German-Style Pilsener
style.description: A classic German Pilsener is very light straw or golden in color and well hopped. Perception of hop bitterness is medium to high. Noble-type hop aroma and flavor are moderate and quite obvious. It is a well-attenuated, medium-light bodied beer, but a malty residual sweetness can be perceived in aroma and flavor. Very low levels of sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) character are below most beer drinkers' taste thresholds and are usually not detectable except to the trained or sensitive palate. Other fermentation or hop related sulfur compounds, when perceived at low levels, may be characteristic of this style. Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be perceived. There should be no chill haze. Its head should be dense and rich.

style.name: German-Style Pilsener

data.name: Pils
data.description: Crisp, clean and incomparably quaffable, Hardywood Pils sparkles a brilliant shade of gold with a rich, cloud-white head. Hand crafted with only the finest European pilsner malt and German noble hops, Pils is patiently conditioned for weeks in our lagering tanks, maturing into a beer that refreshes the palate and satiates the soul. Brewed in strict accordance with the Reinheitsgebot, this classic pilsner is the quintessential lager beer in its purest form. A tad drier than its Bohemian cousin with the signature snappy herbal spice of Bavarian Hallertau hops to balance delicate maltiness, this pils offers a nod to old world tradition by the innovative brewers at Hardywood. Prost!

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

breweries.name: Hardywood Park Craft Brewery
breweries.description: Hardywood Park Craft Brewery is proud to be a member of the thriving craft beer scene in Richmond, VA.  Located in Richmond’s historic German brewing district, Hardywood features a 20 barrel brewing system, public taproom and outdoor beer garden, and a private event taproom.  Join us during public taproom hours, Wednesday through Sunday, and enjoy free live music, bocce ball, corn hole, local food trucks, craft fairs and brewery tours in addition to our award winning craft beer, brewed in the heart of Richmond.

data.name: Pils
data.description: Pils is our dry-hopped, unfiltered lager created with 100% German malt and Saphir hops in the kettle and fermenter. Spicy noble hop character over sweet Pilsner malt.

breweries.name: Perennial Artisan Ales
breweries.description:
Our philosophy is to brew beer with the adventurous craft beer drinker in mind—focusing on hand-crafted, small batches of beer, using local, seasonal and organic ingredients as much as possible.

Our beers are influenced mostly by Belgian and American craft styles, but the addition of premium ingredients such as fruits, spices or wild yeast strains sometimes causes the beers to defy traditional categories. Our barrel aging program features a wide variety of beers aged in wine and spirits barrels, ranging from a Rye barrel-aged Mexican Chocolate Stout to a wild yeast-fermented Saison aged on Missouri wine grapes in French oak wine barrels. We strive to always achieve balance with each of our recipes, making our beers exceptional with food.

breweries.name: Augustiner-Bräu
breweries.description: Since 1328 on Augustiner beer had been brewed within the monastery of the Augustinian Brotherhood near the cathedral of Munich. After nearly 500 years of tradition, the secularization in 1803 and the following privatisation led to a privately owned company: Augustiner Bräu. In 1817 it moved to the Neuhauser Straße, the very same place where the renowned "Stammhaus" still stands today. In 1829 the Wagner family took over the company and eventually moved it to the "Kellerareal" at the Landsberger Straße in 1885.

breweries.name: Wernesgrüner Brauerei GmbH
breweries.description: The Wernesgrüner brewery can look back on a very long history: in 1436, the brothers Schorer were granted the right to brew and serve beer in the village of Wernesgrün in the state of Saxony. Today, the Wernesgrüner Pils Legende brand is one of the most popular Pilsener beers in Germany.

data.name: Pils
data.description: For generations, the fine recipe has been passed down from master brewer to brew master. A secret recipe, it is not: hops, malted barley, water and yeast. But some instinct to brew from these four, simple at first glance ingredients our excellent Pils can only be acquired in intensive teaching at the brew kettle.

breweries.name: 3 Sheeps Brewing Co
breweries.description:
All families have their stories: tales of grandparents and great-grandparents and the incredible things they accomplished, or lived through, or overcame. My family was no different. I grew up hearing stories that cascaded across a broad plain of topics, but the ones that fascinated me most centered around the Kingsbury Breweries.

Back in 1926, the Kingsbury Breweries, then known as the Gutsch Brewery, declared bankruptcy. It was a tough time for breweries across the country as Prohibition was in full effect. Many breweries failed during that time, and the Gutsch Brewery was on its way to joining them. It was at this time that my family took the helm of the brewery. Soon after, they changed the name to the Kingsbury Breweries, expanded coast-to-coast, and turned the brewery into what we remember it as today.

I grew up hearing stories from my father, who, as a child with his father, would go around the various Kingsbury Breweries, see the brewers hard at work, and watch the customers enjoy a beer in the Ratskellar. This is where my interest was first piqued by the great world of beer. Many years later, thanks to a brilliant gift on my wife’s part, I started making my own beer. From that point forward there was no turning back. The hobby turned into a passion, which turned into an obsession, which turned into quitting my day job and opening a brewery.

This is my Really Cool Waterslide - my choice to take a dream and make it my reality. Thank you to all those who have helped me get here.

- Grant Pauly, 3 Sheeps Brewing

data.name: Pils
data.description: This is our take of the renowned Bohemian-style pale lager that you might find in Bavaria or the Czech Republic.  Ours is a little more golden, rounder, and a little more malt driven than many other versions.  The beer possesses strong hop character that is balanced by its rich, round, malty palate.  Refreshing and balanced, this beer is a favorite of our winery friends during harvest.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: Bohemian-Style Pilsener
style.description: Traditional Bohemian Pilseners are medium bodied, and they can be as dark as a light amber color. This style balances moderate bitterness and noble-type hop aroma and flavor with a malty, slightly sweet, medium body. Extremely low levels of diacetyl and low levels of sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) character, if perceived, are characteristic of this style and both may accent malt aroma. A toasted-, biscuit-like, bready malt character along with low levels of sulfur compounds may be evident. There should be no chill haze. Its head should be dense and rich.

breweries.name: Heater Allen Brewing
breweries.description:
We are a small artisan brewery located in McMinnville, Oregon.  We specialize in producing distinctive all-malt lager and other German and Czech style beers.  We use only the finest, most appropriate malts, hops, water and yeast in our beers.  While our lagers are similar to those made in Germany, they are our own unique interpretation of the style. 

Lager beers are fermented at lower temperatures than ale, using yeast that has adapted to cooler fermentations.  Low temperature fermentations create fewer “yeasty” aromas, esters, and flavors that are so common in ales.  We brew lagers because we enjoy their smooth malty and hoppy character.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: If you'd like to stop by the Brewery, either come by on a brew day, usually Tuesdays and Fridays (check the calendar for a complete list of brew days) or call us during the week (we rarely check messages on the weekend) to schedule an appointment.

data.name: Pils
data.description: This is our take on a traditional German Pilsner. Generously hopped with a blend of Hallertauer and Saaz and fermented with a classic Bavarian yeast. Inspired by Munich, and our cycling adventures through Germany and the Czech Republic.

breweries.name: Fourpure Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Fourpure is a London based family brewery founded in 2013. Beer is our passion and our travels are what inspire us to brew. Our approach to exceptional brewing is all about attention to detail, not cutting corners and innovating yet staying true to the principles of brewing – respecting the four core ingredients used to make beer: grain, yeast, hops and water. This was the inspiration for the name Fourpure.

data.name: Pils
data.description: This traditional German-style pilsner provides the flavor and aroma of German malt and hops with a clean, crisp finish. Prost!

breweries.name: Daredevil Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Daredevil Brewing Co is a production brewery & taproom located in the Speedway neighborhood of Indianapolis. Our goal from the beginning was to simply have fun and make craft beers that we enjoy and that we enjoy sharing with others.
 
We started the brewery with one year round beer, Lift Off IPA, a West Coast Style IPA inspired by many of the classic American IPAs from California that we enjoy. Lift Off IPA quickly grew to become one of the best selling craft beers across Indianapolis and Indiana. Due to market demand we reached capacity at our original production-only brewery on the southeast side of Indianapolis in mid-2013. To expand we purchased a 2.0-acre site in the Speedway neighborhood of Indianapolis in February 2014.
 
We relocated all of our operations to the new location in May 2015. While we are most known for our flagship Lift Off IPA since relocating to the new brewery we also now distribute year round on draft and in cans our Vacation Kölsch, Muse Belgian Golden Ale, and Rip Cord Double IPA and we have a quarterly special release program with a focus on traditional German-style lagers, American IPAs and flavorful ales.

data.name: Pils
data.description: A Northern German style Pilsner, which translates to a dry, crisp beer with a strong floral bitterness.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: American-Style Pilsener
style.description: This classic and unique pre-Prohibition American-style Pilsener is straw to deep gold in color. Hop bitterness, flavor and aroma are medium to high, and use of noble-type hops for flavor and aroma is preferred. Up to 25 percent corn and/or rice in the grist should be used. Malt flavor and aroma are medium. This is a light-medium to medium-bodied beer. Sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS), fruity esters and American hop-derived citrus flavors or aromas should not be perceived. Diacetyl is not acceptable. There should be no chill haze. Competition organizers may wish to subcategorize this style into rice and corn subcategories.

breweries.name: The Commons Brewery
breweries.description: The Commons Brewery is a small craft brewery located in Southeast Portland, Oregon.

data.name: Pils
data.description: A German-style Pilsner, dry, crisp, with a grassy hop aroma from a large kettle addition of Hallertau Mittelfrüh. One hop, one malt, lager yeast. As simple as beer gets.

breweries.name: Fair State Brewing Cooperative
breweries.description: Fair State Brewing Cooperative is Minnesota's first and only cooperatively-owned brewery, where you can truly drink like you own the place. Named one of RateBeer's top ten new brewers in the world for 2015, e concentrate on brewing high quality hoppy, German, and sour beers. We seek to bring a unique collective perspective to Minnesota's craft beer world, creating beer of the people, for the people.

breweries.name: Ithaca Beer Company
breweries.description:
Ithaca Beer Co.,established in 1998, has a mission to brew delicious beers for the purpose of making life more enjoyable. We strive to make this company better and build our brand name and good reputation among our customers.

Over the last decade we have worked hard doing just that, and we have had lots of fun in the process!  From our friendly staff to the award-winning beer to our community outreach, Ithaca Beer continues to brew beers for the purpose of making your simple moments worthwhile.  Take a moment to look around our brand new site and learn about more about Ithaca Beer as a company, the beers we brew, and our involvement in Ithaca, NY.

data.name: Pils
data.description: Our fine Bavarian premium-quality Pils is known for its choice hop bitters and refreshingly tangy flavor. This is attributed not least to the unique aromatic hops obtained from the Hallertau Region.

breweries.name: Schlossbrauerei Maxlrain
breweries.description: Schlossbrauerei Maxlrain is first mentioned in 1636. It was a “brown beer” brewery as was customary in those times. While a great deal has changed in the meantime, essential features have survived. Thus, Maxlrain is and remains a local private brewery under independent management. The fifteen styles of beer classified under pale ale, dark ale, Pils or wheat beer are all brewed applying manual skills utilizing finest ingredients enhanced by our own source of spring water drawn from the Mangfall Valley.

style.name: International-Style Pilsener
style.description: International Pilseners are straw/golden in color and are well attenuated. This medium-bodied beer is often brewed with rice, corn, wheat, or other grain or sugar adjuncts making up part of the mash. Hop bitterness is low to medium. Hop flavor and aroma are low. Residual malt sweetness is low--it does not predominate but may be perceived. Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be perceived. Very low levels of sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) character, if perceived, are acceptable. There should be no chill haze.

style.name: German-Style Pilsener
style.description: A classic German Pilsener is very light straw or golden in color and well hopped. Perception of hop bitterness is medium to high. Noble-type hop aroma and flavor are moderate and quite obvious. It is a well-attenuated, medium-light bodied beer, but a malty residual sweetness can be perceived in aroma and flavor. Very low levels of sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) character are below most beer drinkers' taste thresholds and are usually not detectable except to the trained or sensitive palate. Other fermentation or hop related sulfur compounds, when perceived at low levels, may be characteristic of this style. Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be perceived. There should be no chill haze. Its head should be dense and rich.

data.name: Pils
data.description: This year-round porch beer has a crisp bitterness that balances gentle hop aromatics of citrus rind and fresh cut flowers.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: German-Style Pilsener

breweries.name: Uinta Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Named after the only major east-west running mountain range located in the continental U.S., Uinta Brewing Company's journey began in 1993 with the reality that passion for craft beer and a hankering for the great outdoors could align in Salt Lake City, UT.
 
Built on an axis point that endorses sustainability, community involvement and innovation, their compass guides them on a path to admirable, consistent craft beer leading consumers to discover a brand with passion, personality and soul.  Precisely, GREAT BEER is Uinta's True North.

style.name: American-Style Pilsener
style.description: This classic and unique pre-Prohibition American-style Pilsener is straw to deep gold in color. Hop bitterness, flavor and aroma are medium to high, and use of noble-type hops for flavor and aroma is preferred. Up to 25 percent corn and/or rice in the grist should be used. Malt flavor and aroma are medium. This is a light-medium to medium-bodied beer. Sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS), fruity esters and American hop-derived citrus flavors or aromas should not be perceived. Diacetyl is not acceptable. There should be no chill haze. Competition organizers may wish to subcategorize this style into rice and corn subcategories.

style.name: International-Style Pilsener
style.description: International Pilseners are straw/golden in color and are well attenuated. This medium-bodied beer is often brewed with rice, corn, wheat, or other grain or sugar adjuncts making up part of the mash. Hop bitterness is low to medium. Hop flavor and aroma are low. Residual malt sweetness is low--it does not predominate but may be perceived. Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be perceived. Very low levels of sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) character, if perceived, are acceptable. There should be no chill haze.

breweries.name: Schussenrieder Erlebnisbrauerei
breweries.description:
Welcome to the page of the SCHUSSENRIEDER adventure brewery with Germany's 
first beer jug museum . 
Here you have the opportunity to inform yourself about our family brewery with its versatile offer and its numerous events in line with the motto: "Come - Amazement - Good Mood".

Have fun with your brewing family Ott and all employees of the SCHUSSENRIEDER adventure brewery with Germany's first beer jug ​​museum!

Michael and Jürgen Josef Ott

style.name: German-Style Pilsener
style.description: A classic German Pilsener is very light straw or golden in color and well hopped. Perception of hop bitterness is medium to high. Noble-type hop aroma and flavor are moderate and quite obvious. It is a well-attenuated, medium-light bodied beer, but a malty residual sweetness can be perceived in aroma and flavor. Very low levels of sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) character are below most beer drinkers' taste thresholds and are usually not detectable except to the trained or sensitive palate. Other fermentation or hop related sulfur compounds, when perceived at low levels, may be characteristic of this style. Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be perceived. There should be no chill haze. Its head should be dense and rich.

data.name: Pils 4 Rils
data.description: This rich light lager is brewed with 100% Belgian pilsner malt and Saaz hops. Crisp, complex and stronger than a traditional German pils, this one is a Pils-4-Rils!

style.name: Bohemian-Style Pilsener
style.description: Traditional Bohemian Pilseners are medium bodied, and they can be as dark as a light amber color. This style balances moderate bitterness and noble-type hop aroma and flavor with a malty, slightly sweet, medium body. Extremely low levels of diacetyl and low levels of sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) character, if perceived, are characteristic of this style and both may accent malt aroma. A toasted-, biscuit-like, bready malt character along with low levels of sulfur compounds may be evident. There should be no chill haze. Its head should be dense and rich.

breweries.name: Benoit-Casper Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Benoit Casper Brewing is a microbrewery located in Richmond, California. 

Marc Benoit and Chad Casper own and operate their 3.5bbl Microbrewery, specializing in small batches of delicious beer.

style.name: American-Style Pilsener
style.description: This classic and unique pre-Prohibition American-style Pilsener is straw to deep gold in color. Hop bitterness, flavor and aroma are medium to high, and use of noble-type hops for flavor and aroma is preferred. Up to 25 percent corn and/or rice in the grist should be used. Malt flavor and aroma are medium. This is a light-medium to medium-bodied beer. Sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS), fruity esters and American hop-derived citrus flavors or aromas should not be perceived. Diacetyl is not acceptable. There should be no chill haze. Competition organizers may wish to subcategorize this style into rice and corn subcategories.

breweries.name: Evil Twin Brewing
breweries.description:
We Have all good intentions to disturb, disorder and enlighten you with unforgettable beer after beer.

Because We are so much in love with good taste, all the beers from Evil Twin are prepared in 10 of the best breweries around the world. Exclusively hand picked to please you with delicate, funky, extreme and by all means rare flavors. Maybe not the easiest way, but certainly the most fun!!!

One More Thing, A clever man once said: 'Stay thirsty... stay foolish.' That sounds like our vision, just with a tad less attitude.

data.name: Pils and Thrills
data.description: No bellyaches! Lighten up and chill out with our classic, easy-drinking pilsner—perfect for a hot summer day. We serve ours mixed as a British-inspired, scurvy-repelling shandy with lemonade.

style.name: Bohemian-Style Pilsener
style.description: Traditional Bohemian Pilseners are medium bodied, and they can be as dark as a light amber color. This style balances moderate bitterness and noble-type hop aroma and flavor with a malty, slightly sweet, medium body. Extremely low levels of diacetyl and low levels of sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) character, if perceived, are characteristic of this style and both may accent malt aroma. A toasted-, biscuit-like, bready malt character along with low levels of sulfur compounds may be evident. There should be no chill haze. Its head should be dense and rich.

breweries.name: Pleasant House Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Pleasant House Brewing Company is an independently owned microbrewery focusing on small-batch, true-to-style beers, especially traditional UK styles.

The original Pleasant House is an 1800s cottage that still looks out on the rolling green hills of rural Yorkshire, England. In the 1950s and ’60s, the Jackson family called Pleasant House home. Today, it is the inspiration behind husband and wife team Art and Chelsea Jackson’s Pleasant House restaurants and microbrewery. Our beers pair brilliantly with our award-winning, savory Royal Pies and other British-inspired, locally sourced specialties.

All of our microbrews are crafted on the premises in our historic 1887 building in Three Oaks, Michigan.

data.name: Pils Czech Style Pilsener
data.description: Our first and only lager, brewed with loads of Sax hops imported from the Czech Republic and a bottom-fermenting yeast strain that leaves it light and crisp and easy to slam, yet full of flavor and all the things you yearn for.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: International-Style Pilsener
style.description: International Pilseners are straw/golden in color and are well attenuated. This medium-bodied beer is often brewed with rice, corn, wheat, or other grain or sugar adjuncts making up part of the mash. Hop bitterness is low to medium. Hop flavor and aroma are low. Residual malt sweetness is low--it does not predominate but may be perceived. Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be perceived. Very low levels of sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) character, if perceived, are acceptable. There should be no chill haze.

breweries.name: Lagunitas Brewing Company
breweries.description:
From our earliest days of striving to make consistently good beer, and instead making beer that ranged from vile, to barely drinkable, to wonderful, to elegant, to questionable-at-best. From being castigated by our West Marin neighbors to finally suffering an 'eviction' by our West Marin septic system. From landing in the welcoming arms of Petaluma, and actually getting our beer into bottles, onto the streets, and into the hands of sympathatic beer geeks, to steadily losing less money each month. From all this and more, Lagunitas Brewing Company is emerging as a battle-tested brewery capable of making great beer out of goat's milk, brambles, and asphalt on the surface of the Moon, if need be.

As the poet once said, 'Where, but for the grace of God and the kindness of strangers, go I'. Where go we indeed, whatever that means.

style.name: German-Style Pilsener
style.description: A classic German Pilsener is very light straw or golden in color and well hopped. Perception of hop bitterness is medium to high. Noble-type hop aroma and flavor are moderate and quite obvious. It is a well-attenuated, medium-light bodied beer, but a malty residual sweetness can be perceived in aroma and flavor. Very low levels of sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) character are below most beer drinkers' taste thresholds and are usually not detectable except to the trained or sensitive palate. Other fermentation or hop related sulfur compounds, when perceived at low levels, may be characteristic of this style. Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be perceived. There should be no chill haze. Its head should be dense and rich.

breweries.name: Mikkeller
breweries.description:
The story of Mikkeller is the story of two homebrewers that in a few years went from hobby brewing in the kitchen to national and international recognition.

Since the summer of 2007, Mikkel Borg Bjergsø, has run Mikkeller on his own. Mikkel is a gipsy-brewer, who brews at different breweries in Denmark, around Europe and the United States

data.name: Pils Mafia
data.description:
We can’t hold this secret any longer... Over the last year we have been brewing up THE Buffalo beer for this upcoming football season. #pillsmafia will be released Saturday, September 8th at 11am in 4 packs and cases at our Elmwood Village taproom. 

We had the pleasure of chatting with some key members of our beloved Buffalo football fanbase to include their likenesses on this can design. A portion of proceeds will benefit superfan Pancho Billa's foundations including Fans Against Child Abuse, Fans Against Violence, NFL and MLB Go Gold for Kids Cancer, and his personal cancer relief fund. And of course... we had to include Tristan Lambright best known for his performance at the Saints game last season!

This 4.9% crisp, clean, German Pilsner is for all of the upcoming fall pregaming sessions outside of New Era Field, on the couch screaming at the TV with your face painted red and blue, spilling on your jersey as your ass hits your folding table, and of course, enjoying with your friends and families while supporting your hometown. All of the wonderful things that we love about our hometown team, in a can.

Very low levels of sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) character are below most beer drinkers' taste thresholds and are usually not detectable except to the trained or sensitive palate. Other fermentation or hop related sulfur compounds, when perceived at low levels, may be characteristic of this style. Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be perceived. There should be no chill haze. Its head should be dense and rich.

breweries.name: Thin Man Brewery
breweries.description: The only brewery operating in Buffalo's historic Elmwood Village... Join us for fresh, housemade dishes and some of the best beer you'll find anywhere!

data.name: Pils No.1
data.description:
Classic, southern German Pils with pronounced, pleasant bitterness and fine hop flower.
 
The use of the pottery varieties Hallertauer Perle and Hallertauer tradition lend the no. 1 a particularly tart, hop-aromatic character.
 
Very soft brewing water and a bright Pilsen malt are the basic prerequisites for a round pile flavor.

data.name: Pils ou Face
data.description:
This beer was created on April 22nd, 2009.

It is composed of 3 varieties of cereals and 1 variety of hop.

It’s up to you to let the aromas of this «Lager» charm you!

style.name: Bohemian-Style Pilsener
style.description: Traditional Bohemian Pilseners are medium bodied, and they can be as dark as a light amber color. This style balances moderate bitterness and noble-type hop aroma and flavor with a malty, slightly sweet, medium body. Extremely low levels of diacetyl and low levels of sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) character, if perceived, are characteristic of this style and both may accent malt aroma. data.name: Pils Party
data.description: Pils Party is our ode to the Premium American Lager.  Brewed with 30% corn sugar this lager has a classic pilsner dryness with a restrained bitterness and a clean, adjunct lager finish. Light hop aromatics tease the nose with notes of noble spice and a hint of fresh cut flowers.  Blonde in color and ready to party!
data.foodPairings: Goes well with just about anything but especially well with Indian food

style.name: American-Style Premium Lager
style.description: This style has low malt (and adjunct) sweetness, is medium bodied, and should contain no or a low percentage (less than 25%) of adjuncts. Color may be light straw to golden. Alcohol content and bitterness may also be greater. Hop aroma and flavor is low or negligible. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent. Note: Some beers marketed as "premium" (based on price) may not fit this definition.

breweries.name: Hops & Grain Brewery
breweries.description: Hops and Grain is a local Austin brewery that produces hand-crafted ales and handmade dog treats. We are very passionate about our craft and strive to create sustainability in everything that we do

data.name: Pils World
data.description:
Pils World—with a name affectionately inspired by the famous Phil’s World mountain bike trails outside of Durango— lends a light malt backbone to a moderately bitter hop presence, transitioning to a lemony, orange zest and finishing with a touch of tropical fruit. 

Set your mouth ablaze with all of the Thai, Mexican or jerk seasoning you can tolerate, because Pils World is here for you. It’s bitter enough to cut through the spice and sweet enough bring the heat to its knees.


Read more at: http://mybeerbuzz.blogspot.com/2016/09/ska-brewing-to-debuts-pils-world-at-gabf.html#ixzz4LwLEahac 
Follow us: @mybeerbuzz on Twitter | mybeerbuzz.com on Facebook

data.name: Pils-Gnar
data.description: This beer will let you receive liquid happiness after a day of going full send. The Melvin crew teamed up with the hometown shredders of Teton Gravity Research to bring you this bright and drinkable pilsgnar, perfect to pack for your next day on the hill.

breweries.name: Melvin Brewing
breweries.description: This is the home of The Melvin Brewing Company. We are beer lovers that specialize in IPAs, but believe in crafting the best beer in any style. Accept for you know, like German and English beers and whatnot. Ok, Europe in general we reckon.  We are located in Thai Me UP Restaurant in Hole, Wyoming

data.name: Pils-Noir
data.description: We are pleased to share our innovative black Pilsner, Pils-Noir. Made from Pearl (Winter) barley, malted for us by Munton’s, CaraMalt and Crystal malts, prepared using our unique, husk-free milling process. We then naturally darken the beer using the classic Czech technique of decoction mashing. Hopped with Oregon Willamette, Mt. Hood and Washington hops, and finished with noble Czech Saaz for a fine aroma.

breweries.name: Susquehanna Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Susquehanna Brewing Company delivers prosperity and enjoyment to our Northeastern Pennsylvania (NEPA) customers and consumers through our quality, craft beers made locally in an environmentally responsible fashion.

We’re beer people. It’s in our blood. 6th generation and going strong. Back before it was hip to brew beer, our grandfathers’ grandfathers spent time crafting the perfect, drinkable beer right here in northeastern Pennsylvania. The beer brewing torch has been passed down, and now it’s our turn. To make the kind of beer you can enjoy all day long, if you’re so inclined. And we have to admit, someti...See More

breweries.name: Cerveceria Costa Rica
breweries.description:
Guided by our values ​​and with a fixed eye  on the type of company we want to become, we have taken firm steps and  achieved very good results in the three dimensions we  work with. During 2015, the business units that make up FIFCO  confirmed their commitment to excellence in execution, innovation,  the well-being of our employees and sustainable development. 

Today more than ever we reiterate our commitment to share with the  world a better way of living and generating value by contributing to the development  of the communities in which we have a presence. 

In this sense, it is extremely important to create these spaces and channels, communicating clearly and completely the performance of our organization, while we invite you to be part of the change that points to a holistic success.

data.name: Pilsen
data.description: Pilsen is the oldest brand in the beer portfolio, since 1904 it has represented Paisa pride as the leading brand in the Antioquia region. Pilsen exists to reaffirm the spirit inherited from paisa berraquera.

data.name: Pilsener
data.description: It was in 1842 that a Bavarian brewermaster first brewed this classic beer style, today the most popular style in Germany and the world.  Our Pilsener is everything that a true Pils should be: clear golden color with a dense white head, full of barley malt body and balanced with a perceptible noble hop bitterness.
